summary: James A. Noel was a CIA employee who was removed from the CIA Retirement and Disability System in 1968. He is mentioned in documents related to the Western Hemisphere Division of the CIA, specifically concerning activities in Latin America and Cuba between 1946 and 1965. His name appears in a compilation of cryptonyms, aliases, and true names related to CIA personnel and operations, particularly those concerning Cuban-related activities and responses to requests from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is also mentioned in connection to Manuel Ray y Rivero, a figure in the Cuban exile community.
significance: Medium. James A. Noel's involvement with the CIA, particularly his work in Latin America and Cuba, and his appearance in documents related to the HSCA, suggest a moderate level of significance within the context of the source material. While not a central figure, his connections and activities warrant attention.
